intro: Elaeocarpus novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea elaeocarp, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces fleshy, orange-red fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
